column1: Uchi////They have a daily specials menu that is worth perusing each time
column2: usually consisting of an assortment of their freshest seafood (see "Tsukiji Selection"). Their regular menu is a breakdown of cool / hot food
column3: along with an omakase (market price) tasting
column5: and agemono (deep fried food). Having sampled a decent bit of their menu
column6: I can attest their spread is uber fresh
column8: and well executed. Don't forget about their cocktails
column9: which are expertly crafted and are worth coming for without ordering food.
